POR.content: for Heidegger, principle of reason accompanied by interpretation of essence of beings as objects, an object present as representation (Vorstellung)
POR.linkedContent: for Heidegger, principle of reason accompanied by interpretation of essence of beings as objects, an object present as representation (Vorstellung)

POR.content: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence
POR.linkedContent: principle of reason (Satz vom Grund) tells us to protect [dominant] relation of ob-ject before a subject that says “I”, and is assured of presence

POR.content: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)
POR.linkedContent: Heidegger’s caricature of principle of reason: hard, unblinking eyes (dominating, raping)

GT.content: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift
GT.linkedContent: subject and object are arrested effects of the gift, arrests of the gift; subject as such never gives or receives a gift

VM.content: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object
VM.linkedContent: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object

OOG.content: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness
OOG.linkedContent: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness

OOG.content: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region
OOG.linkedContent: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

VP.content: le pré de l’objet présent maintenant-devant est un contre (Gegenwart, Gegenstand) à la fois au sens du tout-contre de la proximité et de l’encontre de l’op-posé
VP.linkedContent: le pré de l’objet présent maintenant-devant est un contre (Gegenwart, Gegenstand) à la fois au sens du tout-contre de la proximité et de l’encontre de l’op-posé

VP.content: for Husserl, object is relative, subject is absolute
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, object is relative, subject is absolute

GSP.content: neither structure (which isolates objective significations in their static originality) nor genesis (which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other) clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity
GSP.linkedContent: neither structure (which isolates objective significations in their static originality) nor genesis (which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other) clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity

GSP.content: noema: the “as such” > does not borrow its materiality from consciousness, an object (but not real) > nonappurtenance to any region, anarchy of noema > root of all objectivity
GSP.linkedContent: noema: the “as such” > does not borrow its materiality from consciousness, an object (but not real) > nonappurtenance to any region, anarchy of noema > root of all objectivity

GSP.content: wouldn’t this nonreality disrupt the inclination toward regionality of phenomenological method?
GSP.linkedContent: wouldn’t this nonreality disrupt the inclination toward regionality of phenomenological method?

WAP.content: working w/ Bourdieu’s idea of objectification, Derrida sees an infinite task: “objectifiable” is not objectifiable: always exceeds scene of visibility
WAP.linkedContent: working w/ Bourdieu’s idea of objectification, Derrida sees an infinite task: “objectifiable” is not objectifiable: always exceeds scene of visibility

WAP.content: achievement of “complete objectification” would ensure sociology’s absolute hegemony, i.e. absolute knowledge
WAP.linkedContent: achievement of “complete objectification” would ensure sociology’s absolute hegemony, i.e. absolute knowledge

WAP.content: what if truth of objectivity no longer took the form of an object?
WAP.linkedContent: what if truth of objectivity no longer took the form of an object?

AFR.content: how can Locke carve out a trail while repeating an earlier rupture? he applied a general law to particular domain
AFR.linkedContent: how can Locke carve out a trail while repeating an earlier rupture? he applied a general law to particular domain

AFR.content: by preceding analogically, he discovered an unknown > invention by analogy (or analysis): new “objects” created by transposing, proportioning, analyzing
AFR.linkedContent: by preceding analogically, he discovered an unknown > invention by analogy (or analysis): new “objects” created by transposing, proportioning, analyzing

AFR.content: [which objectifies? the idea of the object or the sensing of the object?]
